Hal::Core Class Reference

Documentation

This is the Core class. It is used to access core MCU information such as clock speed and to adjust interrupt priorities.

Here is an example of how to read the MCU serial number:

#include <stfy/Hal.hpp>
#include <cstdio>
int main(int argc, char * argv[]){
int i;
Core core(0);
core_attr_t attr;
core.open();
core.attr(&attr);
printf("Serial Number is:");
for(i=3; i >= 0; i--){
printf("%X", attr.serial_number[i]);
}
printf("\n");
core.close(); //core is never "powered-down" but this frees the file descriptor
}

Parameters

Change pin functionality using a core_pinfunc_t structure

int Hal::Core::setpinfunc ( int  port,
int  pin,
int  func,
int  func_port 
)
inline

Change pin function. This can be used if the default pinassign values are not adequate for your application.

Parameters
portThe PIO port
pinThe PIO pin number
funcThe function (e.g. Core::UART)
func_portThe functional port (e.g. 0 for UART0)
Returns
Zero on success
